channel.title: business on Dwarves Foundation
channel.description: Recent content in business on Dwarves Foundation

item.title: Navigate changes
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Technology comes in waves. You’ve likely noticed this cycle. AI is the current big shift, but before that, we adapted to DevOps, mobile, and the cloud.

item.title: Pricing model: Bill by hours
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: We are all aware of the uncertain economy, as well as the long funding winter in the tech market. These forces have led to companies being extremely cautious with their tech budgeting and resources.

item.title: Collaboration Guideline
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Guidelines for project collaboration between DF and Clients. Tools Project management & communication: Basecamp (invited as Client) Sprint planning & tracking: Jira/Basecamp Meeting: Google Meet Source control platform: Github/Gitlab (self-hosted) Design: Figma/Sketch Schedule Project kick-off meeting: 1 session Sprint length: 1 week/2 weeks Sprint planning meeting: 1 per sprint Sprint review & retrospective meeting: 1 per sprint Sprint daily standup meetings (can as well be done via communication channel or Basecamp’s check-ins) Project/team feedback meeting (with Account Manager): 1 per week or 1 every 2 weeks Meeting notes for Sprint planning and Sprint retrospective will be sent within 30 minutes after meeting.

item.title: FBSC
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Budget We do need to know clients’ budgets. This is often uncomfortable for them but their budget helps determines what scope is possible.

item.title: Lean Canvas
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Lean Canvas Lean Canvas is an adaptation of Business Model Canvas by Alexander Osterwalder which Ash Maurya created in the Lean Startup spirit (Fast, Concise and Effective startup).

item.title: Dwarves Ventures Fund 1
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: It all started back in 2019 when a handful of tech people came under the name of Dwarves Ventures, with the sole mission was to give force to makers and hustlers.

item.title: Dwarves Ventures Fund 0
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: It all started when us, a couple of product people realized with our expertise in technology, our passion for outstanding software, we have the ability to uplift like-minded founders by helping them build and launch their startups.

item.title: Fixed Budget Scope Controlled
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Fixed-Budget, Scope-Controlled (FBSC) is applied at Atomic Object. They build custom software for our customers. Because of the complexity involved in building a great software product, software development projects are always more difficult to price than a product.

item.title: The Adjacent Possible
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: During our study about innovation, we find the topic of adjacent possible. Innovation happens but not many people can point out clearly.

item.title: How we spend money
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: We do the business to provide engineering capabilities to help customers on their business. A part of the benefits package is the Stock Option Plan, and the money is the sensitive topic in most companies, but we want you to understand so you could commit your best to make Dwarves Foundation a right place to work.
